snippet.title: Sports Predictions  with Remote Viewing: Best Practices. Jon Knowles, Debra Katz, & Eric Schöne.
snippet.description: Jon Knowles, M.A., and Debra Lynne Katz, Ph.D. interviewed Eric Schöne, Ph.D.,  who has claimed to be getting consistently strong results after reading their recent book "Associative Remote Viewing: The Art of Science of Predicting Future Outcomes for Sports-betting, Finances, Elections and the Lottery". He states that tightening up protocols for strengthening the proper feedback and time loops while eliminating exposure to other elements that can lead to psi displacement has raised the stats, which is in alignment with our feelings about how to achieve better results. Theories around what leads to better predictions when using this remote viewing system are discussed, including the idea that some events are more solidified in time than others, especially when they are not easily subject to changes of decisions through receipt of intuitive-based knowledge. They also discuss preferred target types, wagering decisions and behaviors, remote viewing approaches, gender-based preferences, challenges, length of session, burn-out, motivations, the lotto, tuning into letters and numbers, the joys and sorrows of this work & other compelling topics related to the science and application of remote viewing. (Follow-up note from Debra: It should be noted that to date we have not been shown evidence of the longer-term stats discussed in this interview, so this interview should not be construed as verification but rather hopeful optimism that the numbers do reflect the claims. We believe all claims of stats should be easily verified and provided for such verification).

snippet.title: Ethics for LightWorkers, Intuitives, Psychics and Meta-physical Practitioners Workshop.
snippet.description: Debra Lynne Katz, Ph.D., M.S.W.,  has been a professional clairvoyant and instructor of intuitive development for over 25 years. She is the founder of The International School of Clairvoyance, which provides quality education, services and research in the intuitive and healing arts. Debra combines her experiences as a practitioner and instructor, along with awareness of ethical considerations for social workers and psychologists to help those who are new to utilizing their skill sets for clients in the areas of metaphysics. This full workshop is presented in its entirety. It is particularly designed for psychics, clairvoyants, mediums, energy healers, and spiritual coaches. The material discussed here is often also discussed in her 12-week courses. The opening of the talk is entitled, "The History and Challenges of metaphysical Practitioners" which is given by Theon Paulino-Filippelli, founder of the new Evolvme.com app. She helped to put together the outline for this presentation and sponsored it as an introduction to the practitioners who will be working with her through Evolveme.

The course is called something like how to use intuition, clairvoyance and remote viewing to find your missing stuff - but it includes tips on finding moving objects like pets and people too. It will be pretty inexpensive like $9.99 when done and hosted through a variety of online sites. It doesn't require any experience although some might help. Think of this as a rough draft edit. If I can keep up the current pace and lack of sleep schedule, I expect to have it done by mid-January.

snippet.title: WHY DO PSYCHOLOGISTS HATE POPULAR PSYCHOLOGY BOOKS?          Debra Katz Dissertation Defense
snippet.description:
Many academic psychologists assert that popular psychology books make false, unsubstantiated or exaggerated claims, distorting evidence & dupe a naive public for financial gain.

They marginalize, stereotype, ban and “other” pop psychology materials and those who write them.

They are often not familiar with the books they are disqualifying.

The general public spends billions of dollars each year on popular psychology materials.

Many people find these books to be helpful and inspiring, even life-saving.

A growing body of evidence demonstrates the effectiveness of popular books for "Bibliotherapy" - which basically can be defined as using books to aid with therapeutic goals. 

Meanwhile, many academic books are seen as too expensive & not as accessible.

What is really going on here? Are the attitudes of these psychologists justified? or is something more sinister going on here? 

This is the presentation I gave to my dissertation committee to meet the requirements of the Ph.d Program at the University of West Georgia's Department of Anthropology, Psychology and Sociology. (it was just called the Department of Psychology when I started the program 5 years prior but the University changed its name). My dissertation itself was transformed into a book that is now available on Amazon here.

snippet.title: Unpacking the intuitive gifts of Ingo Swann: Are Psychic Abilities Learned or Innate?
snippet.description:
Ingo Swann is best known as.a talented psychic (a word he wouldn't have used for himself) who displayed mind blowing examples of psi ability to describe distant locations and objects within an experimental setting as well as PK skills to impact the physical world. He is next known as the father of remote viewing and trainer of a handful of former military remote viewers who have gone onto train generations of remote viewers. Yet few understand the level in which he 1). Was a scientist who advanced the research at SRI and elsewhere in ways that were never revealed in the formal research but are clearly present in his archives; 2). Was someone who did have many exceptional experiences growing up but who worked relentlessly to understand and develop these further so as to make use of them. He did this through the aid of not other trained instructors but through having the great fortune of meeting many researchers along the way who didn't necessarily have the answers but were willing to work with him to adjust and try out new protocols, in the true spirt of science and collaboration. In this presentation guest speakers were invited who also have interacted with Ingos archives. Debra Lynne Katz spent 3 years at University of West Georgia, while going for her Ph.D studying his archives, after having studied with his various students and their students for many years. This is the powerpoint presentation for one of several talks she has given in a series called, "Fridays with Ingo": Within the presentation is the link to the actual talk.

If you'd like a copy of the powerpoint, can access it here: 

https://www.debrakatz.com/video-blog

snippet.title: Interview with Dr. Bengston who healed cancer in mice and teaches energy healing and manifesting.
snippet.description:
In this interview about healing serious illnesses, Debra Lynne Katz and Krishanti interview Dr. Bill Bengston. The Bengston Energy Healing Method is a powerful, safe energy therapy that according to a combination of documented peer reviewed studies combined with testimony from a number of individuals, produces remarkable results for both people and animals with a variety of physical and emotional disorders, including depression, Alzheimer’s, digestive disorder, cataracts, cancer and more.

In 2008, he published “Can Healing Be Taught?” in Explore: The Journal of Science and Medicine. His work on “A Method Used to Train Skeptical Volunteers to Heal in an Experimental Setting” and “Resonance, Placebo Effects, and Type II Errors: Some Implications from Healing Research for Experimental Methods,” was published by The Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine in 2007.  In addition, his book, The Energy Cure has been translated into four languages.

Krishanti and Debra will be sponsoring a healing class taught by Dr. Benston which will be held in early August 2020. Krishanti has taken his classes for 3 years, Debra has not taken his classes but has heard presentations about his research at various scientific conferences.


NOTE: The International School of Clairvoyance & Debra Lynne Katz believe that energy healing should always be carried out in conjunction with all possible modalities and under the care of a licensed medical physician. While we are sponsoring this workshop and very excited about the possibilities that this method offers (or we would not be sponsoring it) the views expressed by any workshop leaders are not necessarily the views of the school. We have seen negative results of clients who have failed to make use of treatments recommended by licensed medical professionals. This had nothing to do with the above healing modality but feel it would only be responsible to state that all methods of treatment, including chemo, radiation and surgery are part of God's work as much as is energy healing. We believe both together can make a difference. Energy healing has less side effects for sure then other alternatives, but doesn't always work for a variety of reasons and should not be the only option under most circumstances.

snippet.title: Mark Twain's "Mental Telepathy" Read by Debra Lynne Katz
snippet.description: While occasionally it is mentioned in various sources that Mark Twain was a believer of psychic phenomena, these completely under represent the extent that Twain experienced telepathy and precognition in his daily life, at first on an unconscious level, and then on a conscious level, as he began to be able to recognize the ways information came into his mind, usually when he least expected it. These were discussed in detail, In a series of autobiographical essays published first in 1891. Now, Debra Lynne Katz, Author of YOU ARE PSYCHIC; & Director of International School of Clairvoyance reads the text for those who would simply like to listen to it. www.debrakatz.com

snippet.title: Psi Development In Stages by Debra Lynne Katz
snippet.description: In this video Debra Lynne Katz, Director of the International School of Clairvoyance, gives an overview of the stages of development a student goes through, discussing different goals, attitudes, approaches and expectations a new student should take vs. an experienced one moving to a professional level. She also outlines the development of a clairvoyant or remote viewing session, identifying 3 main steps - tuning in, probing and organizing/presenting the data. This is not intended to teach the specific techniques but to give an overview of what is involved and serve as a reminder to both newbies and experienced people to let them selves be where they are at and accomplish their tasks at the level they are at. This isn't the most organized lesson in terms of presentation, but at least gives those watching an overall idea of what is involved with both clairvoyant reading and healing methodology and practice and remote viewing practices.

snippet.title: "The Other Side of Hella's Brain" Interview with Russell Targ, Debra Lynne Katz, Michelle Bulgatz
snippet.description:
Psi-Chicks Debra Lynne Katz & Michelle Bulgatz spent 2.5 hours with Russell Targ, author of Mind Reach, Limitless Mind, and Producer of the incredible film Third Eye Spies. Russell Targ was one of the original co-directors of the Stanford Research Institute's Psycho-Energetic's
 Program that was financed by numerous U.S. intelligence and military agencies, and was a developer of remote viewing, specializing in the "outbounder" experient - where a remote viewer would describe the location of an experimenter. Russell, Debra and Michelle are all in agreement that everyone has intuitive gifts and they just have to often have some additional assistance with bringing these out and honing them. He spent hundreds of hours "interviewing" both subjects like Ingo Swann and Pat Price who were already identified as having psychic talent, and then so many others like Hella Hammid along with U.S. senators, generals, scientists, etc., who didn't know they had these abilities. This was an audio interview, with a few visuals thrown in to make it You Tube Worthy.  A written transcript of this Interview can be found in the August 2019 edition of Eight Martini's Remote Viewing Magazine (Issue 17).

snippet.title: Everyday is Valentine's Day!- ISC Valentine's Day Meditation Event Recording 2018
snippet.description:
Join Debra Lynne Katz and our like-minded community of light workers, healers, and teachers from for an inspiring, electrifying, and soothing celebration of love, relationships, healing of self and others as we rejoice in what Valentines is really about: Connections and creating consciousness of those connections.  Friends, students, teachers and graduates (who have their own counseling or intuitive based practices themselves) of the International School of Clairvoyance will lead you and each other in 10-minute meditations and fun exercises with the themes of love, passion, healing, manifesting, creativity,  relationships, romance, self care, intuition, empowerment, and so much more!  Whether you are single, in a relationship, or somewhere in between, these intuitive, clairvoyant based meditations can help make a positive change and difference in your life.  Also, you'll feel like you are just hanging out with your friends as basically the this is the sort of thing those of us involved in this work do - get together with likeminded people, hang out, share our exercises, meditations, wisdom, lessons, projects together, share insights with each other, laugh, cry, and just be ourselves.

So feel alone no more! Life is short, and there is too much love in this world to go for a moment feeling distanced from it.  Make every day Valentines Day!

Love is an energy that makes things grow. Come grow with us.  (You can wear your PJ's!)

Given this was a webinar class, the production value is not that high but you will still enjoy it!

Meditation Leaders include:

Debra Lynne Katz
Jari Pohankova 
Courtney Alex
Natalie Cormier
Joshua Louis   
Tammy LaDrew
El Bea
Linda Marie

 More info about the event, the speakers to be found here:

https://www.debrakatz.com/valentine-s-day-event

snippet.title: Introduction to Archival Research - Ingo Swann Collections
snippet.description: This was for a class project at UWG - In this introduction to Archival Research, Debra Lynne Katz utilizes an auto-ethnographic approach to presenting what Archival research is, how it differs from other research, how to do it, some of the considerations prior to and during the process such as organizational techniques, while giving insights into her own research experiences over a two year period while working within the Ingo Swann Archives located in the Ingrim Library at University of West Georgia. She demonstrates why archival research is so exciting, and how it gives even more of an intimate look into a person of interests life then even their own auto-biography can, as its not just about them but all others they communicated with and the society they lived within at the time. Archival research is an interdisciplinary form of social science research as it is archeological, sociological and psychological. It gives insights into someone's life who has passed that just can not be gained elsewhere, especially if their entire body of work has been donated as has the legendary psychic-artist-author-researcher and research subject Ingo Swann. Feel free to get in touch with Debra at www.debrakatz.com/debrakatz@yahoo.com with any questions about this research.

The purpose was to prepare participants for the days to come where they would be using Associative Remote Viewing to make predictions about sporting events in Las Vegas. There were several people in attendance who had never tried to describe photos with their psychic abilities or to use Associative Remote Viewing, although on the other extreme there were also many extremely experienced viewers, and she wanted to get them up to speed but not bore those who were "veterans" but just remind them of what they already knew, as the goal of the conference was for groups of viewers to do session work and make predictions.

Learn how the status of imagination needs to be upgraded before one can have and make use of visions and pictures ripe with information because imagination is the canvas upon which the information unfolds.

snippet.title: "The Other Side of the Curve" - Daz Smith, Edward Riordan, Debra Katz - Pilot Episode
snippet.description: Pilot Episode "The Other Side of the Curve Webcast Show",  hosted by Debra Lynne Katz, with special guests remote viewers Daz Smit  & Edward Riordan, two of the best and most innovative remote viewers on planet earth. These interviews get to the meat of the topics, (even down to the bones!) discussing issues you won't hear anywhere else because the guests aren't interested in starting at the beginning of their work/careers but instead discussing the issues they are most passionate about from where they are NOW, on "the other side of the curve". Daz Smith is editor of Eight Martini's Magazine and author of "Surfing the Psychic Internet"; "Controlled Remote Viewing" and Remote Viewing Dialogues". (www.remoteviewed.com). He runs some of the largest remote viewing and UFO websites on the internet. Edward Riordan has demonstrated how remote viewing is an art as much as it is an information gathering tool through offering thousands of hours of free on camera demonstrations through his own You Tube Page (www.erviewer.com). Debra Lynne Katz is the Director of the International School of Clairvoyance and author of "You Are Psychic"; "Extraordinary Psychic" and "Freeing the Genie Within" - as well as a film school graduate and former host of Sedona, Arizona's  "The Psychic Explorer" television show. Topics in this 1.45 minute pilot episode include: Remote viewing is an art not just an outcome; Daz Smith's participation in compelling and controversial video projects hosted by the Farsight institute (including how he was tasked with Hitler and JFK at the very same time);  issues around ownership of one's remote viewing sessions and creative works; Ingo Swann and the controversy over is training/monitoring necessary and helpful in remote viewing practice; and why aren't psychologists or other scientists more interested in the inner workings of a remote viewer's/psychic's mind and practices?!

snippet.title: TURN YOUR REMOTE VIEWING PROJECT INTO A FORMAL SCIENTIFIC STUDY! Webinar Recording
snippet.description: Debra Lynne Katz, in partnership with the Applied Precognition Project and the ISC, leads a motivational and education webinar to a group of 20 individuals for the purpose of encouraging those who are already engaged in remote viewing related projects, and specifically those involving repeated trials performed under double blind conditions, to turn their projects into formal scientific studies.  The presentation includes sharing of several remote viewer's sketches with exceptional matches to their feedback photos. Topics such as "guerrilla research", what one needs to do prior to the start of a study, why people without Ph.D's are afraid to take their projects to the next level and how to overcome one' limitations which could be real or imagined. Present day resources such as researchers willing to help, organizations that will do proposal reviews, parapsychology related publications, how to approach the experts were also covered. Also, a poll of prominent parapsychologists was conducted specifically for this event and responses from the experts are included as well.  For a copy of the powerpoint presentation in PDF format, please visit Debra's website where you will find it under the blog post. Or you can download it here (please return for it later). Also, we have created a post webinar survey for those who watch all or most of it. We appreciate you filling out the survey at the link provided here (If you don't see the link please return as it may not be available yet).

snippet.title: "SEE YOU LATER ALLIGATOR" WRITTEN BY & PRODUCED FOR JAMES CREMIN! (1954-2011).
snippet.description: In 2010 or so I was part of a spiritual film group,  that had been started by Amanda Robinson called ISE-LA. There I met some wonderful filmmakers and actors including those in this film. (I may have met a couple also through the Elevate Film Festival Writer's Group in Los Angeles too). ISE-LA had just a bit of funding and I was fortunate to have one of my films selected (Bending Spoons). One of my fellow group members was the sweetest guy named James Cremin. He actually convinced his mother to open up her Hollywood Hills home and to leave town so we could film there, and he took the flack when we moved just about every nick nack and piece of furniture, forgetting exactly where they were all supposed to go when we had to put it all back. James embodied the aspiring filmmaker. He had actually grown up in Hollywood and he lived and breathed film and screenwriting, being an active member of several groups. While he was always reading his work during various writers workshops (He was also an active member of the Alemeda Writer's Group). He had not had any of his scripts produced or optioned. When James came down with Cancer, I decided it was time that changed. At first we sought funding and help from some other groups that he had been a part of (since our original group ISELA had disbanded) but when it looked like that wasn't happening I called up the members of this cast and said, "To hell with it, we don't need funding. Let's just do it". And so we did. The plan was originally to have James direct, but on the scheduled day of filmming (which we had to do in secret at a park without a permit, which wasn't easy given we had several extras as marathon runners) James was too weak from Chemo. Still, he stayed with us out in the hot sun for an entire day, clearly suffering in silence, so he could be part of the production and we did what we could to consult with him where possible. In the end, we found a professional editor willing to edit for peanuts. James wasn't thrilled that we (the editor and myself) had cut down some of his script - it was just too wordy - but we kept the story intact. His script was about his own relationship with his father (Gary Weinberg, plays James' character) and he was pretty emotionally attached. I felt bad because this whole project was done to help him realize his dream of having a script produced, and yet sometimes it's hard for a writer to let go of extra dialog that just slows down the story and it's even harder for the rest of the team to not want to tighten it up.  We drifted apart after that and I set the files aside, waiting to hear what James wanted to do with the film. A few years passed in fact. A month ago or so I e-mailed James but didn't hear back. I did some research and found that he had passed away in 2011. His cancer had been in remission but it did come back. I was glad to see that James had made a documentary about helping others recover from Cancer in the time when we had been out of touch. It is called, "VIsions For Wellness".  James touched many lives and he was a genuinely good guy. I always felt happy to see him and he always seemed so grateful to be part of a group. He was the kind of guy that was just comfortable to be around. Kind of quirky, kind of nerdy, but passionate and knowledgeable about the subjects he loved. He was definitely the teddy bear, huggable type. He never had a wife or kids and perhaps not too many girl friends either, but he had lots of friends and people who adored him. I will always feel inspirited by James' passion for doing what he loved, even when he faced rejection and all sorts of things that we filmmakers and writers all go through. This is his story and his film. Not perfect, but pretty good considering the circumstances.

snippet.title: Remote Viewing Bulls Eye Target Training, Practice & Therapy Webinar - Part I
snippet.description: Associative Remote Viewing Webinar for remote viewers, group, managers, parapsychologists seeking to minimize displacement and improve results with sports or financial wagering; scientific experiments, and remote viewing overall. This webinar was specifically designed by Debra Lynne Katz for members of the Applied Precognition Project (http://appliedprecog.com/). It is applicable to all remote viewers, and to researchers or research subjects involved in experiments that utilize decoy targets or target sets in parapsychology experiments. Note for permissions to utilize content in this presentation please contact it's creator, debra katz at debrakatz@yahoo.com. (www.debrakatz.com).

snippet.title: Starting a Psychic or Energy Healing Business - Part 3
snippet.description: Author of YOU ARE PSYCHIC & EXTRAORDINARY PSYCHIC, and Director of the International School of Clairvoyance, Debra Lynne Katz, answers questions from a highly trained clairvoyant reader/energy healer,  who is interested in embarking on the path of becoming a professional psychic, charging for her services and starting her own business.  In this 3 part series, Debra offers tips based on her own life experience and that of her numerous students that are helpful for anyone wanting to start a home/service based business and who may not have much, if any budget to work with.  Some of the many topics covered include: knowing how much to charge, where to work, how to structure a business, how to attract clients, whether to focus on a single area or diversify, whether it's helpful to get other professional credentials, and what the most important traits and skills are (apart from having psychic and healing talents and skills) and most importantly, designing your business based on your own needs and desires. vs. what you think others want.  Check out her website at www.urpsychic.com

snippet.title: Starting a Psychic Business - Part 2
snippet.description: Author of YOU ARE PSYCHIC & EXTRAORDINARY PSYCHIC, and Director of the International School of Clairvoyance, Debra Lynne Katz, answers questions from a highly trained clairvoyant reader/energy healer, who is interested in embarking on the path of becoming a professional psychic, charging for her services and starting her own business.  In this 3 part series, Debra offers tips based on her own life experience and that of her numerous students that are helpful for anyone wanting to start a home/service based business of any kind, and who may not have much, if any budget to work with.  Some of the many topics covered include: knowing how much to charge, where to work, how to structure a business, how to attract clients, whether to focus on a single area or diversify, whether it's helpful to get other professional credentials, and what the most important traits and skills are (apart from having psychic and healing talents and skills) and designing your business based on your own needs and desires. vs. what you think others want.  Check out her website at www.urpsychic.com

snippet.title: Starting a Psychic or Energy Healing Business - PART I
snippet.description: Author of YOU ARE PSYCHIC & EXTRAORDINARY PSYCHIC, and Director of the International School of Clairvoyance, Debra Lynne Katz, answers questions from a highly trained clairvoyant/healer who is interested in embarking on the path of becoming a professional psychic, charging for her services and starting her own business.  In this 3 part series, Debra offers tips based on her own life experience and that of her numerous students that are helpful for anyone wanting to start a home/service based business and who may not have much, if any budget to work with.  Some of the many topics covered include: knowing how much to charge, where to work, how to structure a business, how to attract clients, whether to focus on a single area or diversify, whether it's helpful to get other professional credentials, and what the most important traits and skills are (apart from having psychic and healing talents and skills) and most importantly, designing your business based on your own needs and desires. vs. what you think others want.  Check out her website at www.urpsychic.com

snippet.title: "Desert Tears" - An ominous ride through my backyard in Phelan, CA, alongside the Aquaduct.
snippet.description:
August 31, 2012. Join us for a sunset drive through the Mojave desert after a rare and welcome rain.  Experience what lies just beyond our backyard in Phelan, California, as we witness miles and miles of endless illegal dumping.  This is America folks, not a third world country! Hard to believe.    We've reported this to the police, we've called the code enforcement people, Phelan is unincorporated so there is no city officials to talk to.   As long as people have to pay for trash in rural areas where they can't afford it or don't care, this will continue. It's not just here but all over the deserts of California. Please help us contact our city officials in San Bernardino County (recently declared Bankruptcy) or state officials. This location begins just a couple hundred yards from the California Aquaduct where county workers drive by all the time! This may very well be where you all get your drinking water from if you live in California!  It's located in between Sheep Creek and Johnson Roads, starting at Luna and we only drove within a couple mile radius.  I shot this film using my Iphone (3G) and edited it using final cut and 3 versions of the same song. I'm calling it "Desert Tears" because I couldn't help but cry as we were filmming because even when I envisioned this project, I didn't realize how bad it was out there until tonight.  Also, the title is in reference to the Don't Litter Ads from the 1980's with the Native American shedding a tear as he steps in the same kind of mess we come across while enjoying the great outdoors. The saddest thing is not much has changed since then, at least not here.  This was completely shot on my IPHONE.                                             www.debrakatz.com  - UPDATE AS OF FEB 4th 2016 - GOOD News! This just arrived in my inbox in a newsletter from the county:

:Six months after San Bernardino County Board of Supervisors Vice Chair Robert A. Lovingood launched an inmate work crew initiative, more than 100 tons of trash and tires have been collected in High Desert communities. Inmate and county work crews cleared 131 parcels, collecting 94.5 tons of trash and 1,980 tires within the First District.
   Lovingood gave special thanks to San Bernardino County Code Enforcement Director Andy Wingert and Code Enforcement Supervisor Ignacio Nunez for their work on the on-going project.
   San Bernardino County Code Enforcement has a smart phone app that makes it easy to make illegal dumping, graffiti and other code enforcement reports in unincorporated areas. The app is available for the iPhone and Droid by searching “SB Code.”

snippet.title: The Maiden and the Mime - Debra Lynne Katz - Mystery/Suspense/love story
snippet.description: This is a quirky,  suspenseful love story/mystery filmed at over 18 different locations in Sedona, Arizona where I lived and attended the Zaki Gordon Institute for Indy filmmaking.  It's about a type A women who falls in love with a Mime who won't remove the makeup from his face.  Shot on just $500 budget, 20 hours a day for 2 weeks.  The stress almost killed me and my cast and crew. Starring Edith Fogel and Ben Gorman and shot with the help of my dear friend, Thomas McArthur.  Edited by my brother Brad Katz. Yes, it's Cheesy...but, well that's me!

snippet.title: Psychic Speedreading - Remote Viewing the immediate future Class - Debra Lynne Katz
snippet.description: On June 8th, 2012, Author Debra Lynne Katz taught this newly created class, all original material she has developed through her own practice, to 12 students through the International School of Clairvoyance. www.urpsychic.com.

snippet.title: PsychicExplorerAmyEpisode.mp4
snippet.description: This is an episode from The Psychic Explorer, Created, hosted and produced by Debra Lynne Katz.  The show aired in Sedona, Arizona, on two networks, from 1999 to 2001.   This episode features a discussion between Debra and her guest, identical twin sister, Amy Katz as they discuss all things psychic. It also features a local astrologer who had a show on the same channel (Geronimo TV) before her - in fact, his show promoted her to call the network only days after arriving in Sedona with a 4 month old baby and pitch her own show, which was on the air less then three weeks later. Geronimo TV only had limited programming so her show aired for 30 minutes every 4 hours.  They had even less programming over the holidays, although the channel was on 5 or 7, so this episode ran about every 2 hours for a month.

snippet.title: Psychic Explorer Demo.mp4
snippet.description: SELF ADMITTED DORKINESS! OK I'M KEEPING THIS UP JUST BECAUSE I HAVE PLANS TO CREATE ANOTHER TV SHOW (BUT AS MY MORE MATURE AND PROFESSIONAL SELF,  IF YOU WILL BELIEVE THAT) AND SOME PEOPLE DON'T BELIEVE I DID HAVE A TV SHOW FOR THREE YEARS!  So This is a selection of scenes from the first television show I created and hosted that appeared on both The Arizona Channel and Geronimo TV, in Sedona, Arizona from 1999 to about 2002.  The show was called  "The Psychic Explorer: Adventures of the Spirit".  The show featured a variety of guests who discussed subjects related to the paranormal and metaphysical.  Guests included musician/chanter Krishna Das, Kazandra Martin, Rachel Mai, D.S. Baron, Tomas, several Tibetian Monks, Anodea Judith, various UFO researchers. Also it featured my own twin sister and my infant son, Manny Katz, (who is now turning 21) was featured in the opening credits of each show. This was prior to the release of my first book, You Are Psychic, at a time when I was just starting to teach clairvoyant reading and healing classes. This program is what motivated me to go to film school and also take broadcasting classes, as I wanted to make sure myfuture shows would have a higher production value and I'd learn how to present in a more polished way. (Also note I was only about 30 years old at the time, am now 51!).

snippet.title: MiracleDetective.mp4
snippet.description: Debra Lynne Katz is the featured paranormal expert on this episode of the Miracle Detective.  She is visited at her home in Moorpark, California, to help the show's host figure out why a talented medical intuitive would sometimes get highly accurate information, and sometimes not.  She explains the intricacies of accessing psychic information and the challenges that all psychics face. It's not easy being psychic...especially when there are people out there who have no understanding of the subject or even worse, are on a rampage to prove, against all evidence, that being psychic is impossible - a theory that Debra Katz finds as crazy as suggest that we don't have the ability to see or hear or breath.

snippet.title: Feedback for remote viewing target assigned on www.sevethsight.org (#222222)
snippet.description:
This is feedback video for viewers who attempted to use remote viewing/psychic skills to describe the location and activity. To see their responses visit www.sevethsight.org and look at blog post "target 222222".  

OK HERE IS THE FEEDBACK!

The Target was a hiking/fishing expedition/day out to a wilderness area (not too far from some hotsprings, this is near Apple Valley, CA., not too far from the Cajon Pass, southern Califronia, where there are very large rocks, rock retaining walls lining the path (built by people long ago), mountainous area, deserty but with lots of desert vegetation and streams running all along. We had to climb over large boulder to get to the water, where there was sand and waterfalls.  There was myself, Danny, our friend Tony who look like Crockodile Dundee in his kakee clothes and my 13 year old son. The guys were fishing.  Tony was smoking something when no one was looking.  Our dogs, Artemis, a white husky and Tony's very large tan dog were with us.  To get to the area we parked, walked down a very long path, hiked in an hour or so and then reached the water where we fished, napped and ate some food from our backpacks.  We were all very happy to be out, but I was somewhat anxious about not wanting myself or others to get hurt.  Also, I was feeling a little ignored as the guys had made bets as to who would catch more fish and they were more focused on that then hanging out with me.  We don't get out much so all of us were very happy. This is near a canyon type area, so as you walk along and up from the water you see a vast wilderness area.  There is sometimes military exercises that go on in the area too.  There were campers and other hikers we passed, although we were not near a camping area, on the other side of the mountain there is at least one camp ground.  So depending on whether you were viewing from way up high or close you would have gotten a different perspective. Important things to get for this target:, people, water,land/water interface, fishing, sunny, warm day, outside, rocky, mountainous area, desert like but also vegetation, emotional states.

Assigned by Debra Lynne Katz, author of YOU ARE PSYCHIC, EXTRAORDINARY PSYCHIC AND FREEING THE GENIE WITHIN (www.urpsychic.com).

snippet.title: My garden
snippet.description: Debra Lynne Katz garden - We just planted everything around June 15th (except the grapevines and apple tree - they were already here when we moved in in December of 2011, but we did have to prune them a lot).  We live in Phelan, CA.  This is our first attempt at gardening.  The infrastructure with the ramshackle gates were here but we trucked in ammendment and planted everything ourselves.  We have no watering system in place so I spent about an hour watering every day if not more.

snippet.title: You Are Worth More Then Your Credit Score.flv
snippet.description:
It's time to let go of the shame and secrecy around your credit score because the fact is 1/3 of 220 million Americans have a low score.  Several million more don't even have one which is seen as just as bad.  In this video, I make the case that the credit score is a weapon utilized by individuals and companies who have found a legitimate way to charge millions of citizens who are already experiencing tough times and are underprivileged even more money or even deny them essential services such as housing, utilities, insurance, jobs, etc.  These are the same citizens that are supposedly protected under the laws that make it a criminal offense to overcharge and deny services on the basis on race, religion, gender, etc.  (notice, I'm calling them "citizens" and not "consumers" as economists love to call us.  Consumers is such a horrid word!! The credit score is deadly to one's spirit because it reduces us to  number and makes people live in fear and shame when they choose to pay for their housing, food and medical care (and their children's) instead of their credit card debt.  Most people aren't seeking to purchase items without paying for them.  Most people these days know the evils of credit cards but are faced with the fact they can't raise their score unless they agree to get a card and put themselves into debt. If they can't raise their score, they are denied a place to rent, a rental car, a mortgage, even basic utility services or auto insurance or a job.   This constitutes extortion!  And no one is talking about this or very few are because most are too busy playing the game. And now, not only are citizens victimized by these reporting agencies that dictate the experiences of hundreds of millions of citizens, but the US government is facing losing it's AAA status and the value of the dollar hinges on whether or not the all mighty and powerful reporting agency of S & P decides to stick it to  Obama, or show some mercy.  The US government is being told to lower it's debt or else.  How to do this?  Tax the American People or take away their benefits, because after all, why do lazy folks like us need government handouts like social security and medicare when we are elderly?  Better take these away so we can make sure the guys on wall street get their bonuses.  Nevermind that is how the US got their debt, by bailing them out after they scammed us.  All cynicism aside, this talk is about empowering people to let go of the shame and put the blame where it's due.  At this same time, this talk demonstrates that even with everything working against us, we can still excel and achieve our dreams, no matter what our score. This is the first video in a series on the subject.  Please spread the word.  Many people you know are suffering from this shame game.  If you are one of the ones who has a good or great score, then all the more power to you.  This isn't saying people shouldn't be held accountable.  But this is not the way to do it.  It's a system gone haywire.

This is the precursor to a groundbreaking documentary and book that I am currently working on.  I promise the real documentary will not just be me talking!  I'm currently seeking funding for this project as well as an agent/publisher for this particular book.  Any help is appreciated!

If you enjoyed this video, you may like my latest book:

Freeing the Genie Within:  Manifesting Abundance, Creativity & Success in Your Life.

Stay Tuned for Part II -- Solutions 



WWW.DEBRAKATZ.COM

snippet.title: BENDING SPOONS (ESP, TELEKENISIS) - comedic short film
snippet.description: What happens when a stoggy old couple decide to try their hand at spoon bending "with the mind only"?  Find out in this comedic, short film by writter/director Debra Lynne Katz.  Starring and written for Juana Samayoa, Hinton Harrison, Edited by Rachel Katz, Director of Photography, Afshin Javadi and produced by Amanda Robsinson and the Instititute for Entertaining Enlightenment (ISEE). All bending Props created and constructed by Danny Kohler and Debra Katz. Location providen by James and Elenor Cremin.  This is not yet the final cut but getting close.  Director Debra Katz is also author of You Are Psychic: The Art of Clairvoyant Reading and Healing (Llewellyn, 2004) and Extraordinary Psychic: Proven Techniques To Master Your Psychic Abiltiies (TBR August, 2008) She is a graduate of the Zaki Gordon Institute for Independent Filmmaking in Sedona, AZ.  Visit www.urpsychic.com.  Thanks to Uri Geller for bringing the concept of Spoon Bending to the United States!
